Subject: Implement Multi-Select Checkbox Filters & Harden JS Logic
Date: 25 July 2025
Summary: This commit marks the successful completion of Task 3.2, the implementation of the core filtering functionality for the application. The sidebar is now populated with dynamically generated, multi-select checkboxes for both families and tags, allowing for powerful, layered searches.
Feature Implementation:
Developed a JavaScript function to dynamically scan the vault data, extract all unique families and tags, and render them as alphabetized checkbox groups in the UI.
Refactored the core filtering logic into a unified pipeline that now combines the live text search with the new multi-select checkbox filters.
Implemented "AND" logic for the checkbox filters, ensuring that only plugins matching all selected criteria are displayed.
Code Hardening & Debugging:
During implementation, a series of TypeError exceptions were identified, caused by data integrity inconsistencies in the vault_master.json file.
The JavaScript functions (handleSearch, populateFilters, renderCards) were significantly refactored to be more "defensive." They now gracefully handle cases where developer, families, or tags fields contain unexpected data types (e.g., arrays, non-string values), preventing script crashes.
The application's core filtering mechanism is now complete and resilient. The project is ready to proceed to the next task in Phase 3.
Signed-off-by: Drew Campbell <drew@subscotia.net>

Work Report: 15 July 2025 Milestone Reached: Backend Data Buildout Complete
This commit marks the completion of the data population and cleaning phase for the Subscotia Vault. The ivault and xvault are now finalized and have been merged into a single, definitive vault_master.json. All objects have been assigned a final, globally unique ID according to the established convention.
Key Achievements in this Commit:
Project Structure & Best Practices:
Transitioned the project to a professional directory structure (/data, /scripts, /archive) to enforce separation of concerns.
Authored the DEVELOPMENT_GUIDE.md, formalizing our coding standards, Git workflow, and architectural principles.
Upgraded the development workflow to use the integrated Git client within the PyCharm Professional IDE.
Final Data Consolidation:
Developed and executed robust scripts to merge the two vaults (merge_master_vaults_with_logging.py), creating a detailed log of the process.
Developed and executed the final ID assignment script (assign_master_ids.py) to apply globally unique IDs to all 3,808 objects in the master vault.
Successfully debugged runtime errors during the ID assignment process, making the script more robust against inconsistent data types.
Documentation & Toolkit Refinement:
Updated the project's README.md to reflect the current status.
Updated the re-initialization prompt to mark the completion of the data buildout milestone.
Added the official ID Naming Convention to the VAULT_GUIDE.md.
Created several new utility scripts, including a dedicated JSON formatter and a powerful, read-only search tool (find_key_value.py).
With the backend data now stable and complete, the project is officially ready to move into Phase 1: Web Application Development.

Phase 1 Kick-off & Local Environment Setup
Date: 15 July 2025
Summary: This commit marks the official start of Phase 1 development. The primary achievement is the successful configuration of the local development environment on the main workstation, paving the way for API development.
Project Alignment: Reviewed all core project documents (Project Plan, Tech Stack, Development Guide) to ensure full alignment on goals and practices.
Documentation Update: Revised the DEVELOPMENT_GUIDE.md to reflect the project's move to a single, definitive vault_master.json file.
Framework Confirmation: Re-assessed and confirmed that Flask is the optimal web framework for the project's needs.
Environment Setup: Successfully configured the project within PyCharm, verified the existing virtual environment, and installed Flask and its dependencies.
Verification: Confirmed the end-to-end environment setup by successfully running a test Flask development server.
The project is now primed for the development of the vault API endpoint.
